revised_title: The Evolution and Function of Arthropod Eyes
tldr: The author examines the structure and function of the eyes in arthropods, identifying three distinct forms: the Compound eye, the Simple Ocellus, and the Compound Ocellus. The study reveals the close relationship between the Compound eye and the Compound Ocellus, and the evolution of these eyes from a common, rudimentary ancestor. The author also explains the role of the Dioptron and Neuron in the functioning of arthropod eyes and discusses the development of the Compound eye.
